isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - INSTALL - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

important.para: : Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the keyway of the gear and stamped with an "O" for easy identification ( Figure 231). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 231. Mark Countershaft Drive Gear For Timing Purposes

svcprocinfo.para: Place the left countershaft assembly into position in the case, making sure that the "L"-marked assembly has the larger 47-tooth PTO gear ( Figure 232). Place the right countershaft assembly into position in the case, making sure that the "R"-marked assembly has the smaller 45-tooth PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 232. Place Left Countershaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Move the left countershaft assembly to the rear and insert the countershaft support tool or blocking to center the shaft in the rear case bore ( Figure 233).

figure.caption: Figure 233. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to start the bearing in the case bore ( Figure 234).

figure.caption: Figure 234. Start Bearing in Case Bore

note.para: The inner race of the roller-type front bearing is pressed on the front of the countershaft.

step1.para: Center the front of the left countershaft in the bearing and move the assembly forward ( Figure 235).

figure.caption: Figure 235. Center Front of Left Countershaft in Bearing

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to completely seat the front bearing or bearing outer race in the case bore ( Figure 236).

figure.caption: Figure 236. Seat Front Bearing or Bearing Outer Race

step1.para: Position the retainer plate on the front of the left countershaft, roll pin in the hole at the end of the shaft, and secure with a bolt ( Figure 237). Tighten to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N· m).

figure.caption: Figure 237. Position Retainer Plate on Front of Left Countershaft

step1.para: Remove countershaft support tool or blocking from rear case bore and install the left countershaft rear bearing with the larger I.D. lead chamfer to the front of the shaft and install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of the left countershaft ( Figure 238).

figure.caption: Figure 238. Install Left Countershaft Rear Bearing
